page.title: 04Industry and employment
page.content: There used to be a lot of mines in the area around Tai'rgwaith but now there is only one private mine employing two men, tge Shand opencast site employing 150 men(many from the village) and the Powell Duffryn Washery where the coal from the opencast is washed and prepared to be sent away by rail. many of the men of Tai'rgwaith work in two deep mines; one at Abernant about four miles away and the other at Betws, about six miles away. Some of the local women work in light industry in various factories within a fifteen mile radius of Tai'rgwaith. Some work at Morris Cohen, Pontardawe, manufacturing lingerie and some at Lucas Industries, Ystradgynlais and Delanair, Ammanford, both factories making car parts. The only other employment is the local shop, Post Office, the two public houses....
